reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars An Enjoyable Dark Thriller with Flaws
reviews.reviewText: An intricate thriller set in mythical Three Pines, Quebec.In the 18th Inspector Armand Gamache mystery, Louise Penny provides a clever plotline, where one mystery segues into another. “A World of Curiosities” begins with a flashback, where Inspector Gamache investigated the death of a female drug addict and uncovered horrendous child abuse and pornography. A decade later, the addict’s damaged children, Fiona and Sam Arsenault, reappear in Three Pines. In a seemingly unrelated incident, the Three Pines residents discover a hidden room containing a bizarre copy of a 17th century painting, the Paston Treasure. As Gamache studies the painting, he realizes that it contains messages directed to him by the serial killer John Fleming.“A World of Curiosities” is well-written literary fiction. The novel affords Louise Penny the opportunity to reflect on good and evil, and how brave men and women move forward in tragic circumstances. It’s dark but worthwhile.As with other books in the Gamache series, “A World of Curiosities” assumes previous knowledge of the Three Pines residents. The plot is elaborate – how often does one read a novel containing two psychopaths?In the last ten years there’s been a trend for thriller writers to feature a villain who is the worst person in their country’s history. This was the case in The Girl in the Eagle’s Talons, the latest Lisbeth Salander novel, where she must deal with the deadly Marcus Branco. In “A World of Curiosities” Inspector Gamache must deal with John Fleming, Canada’s worst villain. It doesn’t make sense that Fleming takes up residence in Three Pines and Gamache fails to recognize him.An enjoyable dark thriller with flaws.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This book is Louise Penney’s best yet.So many characters are so well developed you feel like you know themand would recognize he/she if you saw either on the street or in a dark alley even.The story just draws the reader in, first out of curiosity and then for admiration of her writing.She is the epitome of an author!Thank you for sharing your “gift”

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars So happy to get book 18 from the Gamache series!
reviews.reviewText: I am so happy to receive book 18 from Louise Penny's mystery series with Armand Gamache! Great books and the next one is not out until October!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Excellent story - great plot
reviews.reviewText: I always love Penny’s books. My one complaint is that she definitely believes all the current viewpoints and pushed those issues a bit in this book. She does do a great job of still maintaining good and decent male-female relationships and I love the community and characters.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Another stunning novel….
reviews.reviewText: As the 18th edition in the Chief Inspector Gamache series, this one is just as intriguing and engrossing as the seventeen predecessors. Ms. Penney always provides an opportunity for the reader to not only enjoy the characters and the story but at the same time learn something new and interesting. She delves into issues and events with which those of us in the US can also empathize. Another grand slam!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 29, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I love the Inspector Gamache series. This has to have been one of the hardest for me to read. When i grow attached to the characters and those same characters are threatened, well obviously i really got drawn in. Very intense. Thank you, once again, Louise Penny for the wild ride through Canada. Merci beaucoup. 🦋

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars The Gamache novels just keep getting better
reviews.reviewText: I loved this book and I'm convinced Louise Penny's novels featuring Chief Inspector Gamache just keep getting better.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Louise Penny writes books full of Intrigue and also humanity. The background to each story is well researched, so I always learn something new.
A bit dark in content yet still worth the read. The mystery envelopes over time. It is best to read previous book about the main criminal which I did not. At first I got a little lost.
As usual, the works of Louise Penny are remarkable.So glad for having discovered the Gamache series almost a decade ago!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on January 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: This series is compelling to read, 18 books so far
reviews.reviewText: This series is so well written and is compelling to read. The depth of the characters is so that you feel you actually are next to them, you can visualise them and the village, engrossing from beginning to end
Love Gamache series of books. Cat wait for the next one.
